task.title: Mask Credit Card Numbers
task.shortdesc: Now that the credit card type has been evaluated, we'll use a Field Masker to mask the credit card numbers.

context.p: The Field Masker provides fixed and variable-length masks that mask all data. You can create a custom mask that contains masked positions and revealed positions. And you can use a regular expression mask that defines the string and optionally allows you to reveal one or more groups in the string.
For our pipeline, let's mask all but the last four digits of the credit card number with the following regular expression:(.*)([0-9]{4})
The expression deliberately defines two groups so we can reveal the second group.

step.cmd: From the stage library, select the Field Masker processor and connect it to the Jython Evaluator. Or, from the Pipeline Creation Help Bar, click Select Processor to Connect Field Masker .
With the processor selected, in the Properties panel, click the Mask tab.
Click in the Fields to Mask field. Scroll down the list of fields to select the field that represents credit card data: [20]/value.
step.info: A list of fields displays when the pipeline is valid for data preview. If the list does not display, you can type in the field path: [20]/value.
